Home.name: Hello, I am Arthur BRU
Home.developerJV: Hello, I'm Arthur, a Gameplay Programmer.
Home.developerWeb: Hello, I'm Arthur, a Gameplay Programmer.
Home.info: I am currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science with a focus on video game development at Gaming Campus, in my 3rd year of G.Tech. I am actively seeking an internship starting from May 2, 2025, with the possibility of continuing in an apprenticeship for my 4th year.
Home.aboutMe: Thanks to my experiences, I have been able to refine my technical skills and collaborate effectively with other fields such as the artistic or marketing field. Outside of my studies, I am passionate about basketball!
Home.MySQLDescription:
I have known and practiced MySQL for 4 years, using phpMyAdmin in particular. My experience with LUA and PHP has allowed me to make significant progress in data manipulation with MySQL.

I have primarily used two interfaces to work with databases:



- phpMyAdmin: For its ease of use, management of common tasks, and security.

- DBeaver: I prefer to use it for linux and for its advanced features and cross-platform support.
Home.GitDescription: I started using Git in October 2023, and since then, it has become an essential tool for me. Its usefulness and speed, once the commands are mastered, make it a fantastic tool. I am comfortable with standard commands for project management.
Home.DevOpsDescription: Thanks to my Unity projects, I was able to set up automatic Android builds on GitHub using GitHub Actions. I explored several plugins to improve my build script, such as sending notifications on Discord and uploading files to Dropbox and Google Drive. I also tested GitHub runners as well as my own runners on localhost. Additionally, I got a glimpse of Jenkins and its agent system.

VideoGamesProjects.Title: My video game projects
VideoGamesProjects.helluvaRevenge:
Here is a video game created within 4 weeks; we had to handle all aspects of development and asset creation/research. The game was developed in C++ using the SFML library on a custom engine.

- Group of 6 students.
VideoGamesProjects.towerDefense:
Here is a Tower Defense game developed in 1 week with the theme of League of Legends.
- Group of 5 students.
VideoGamesProjects.platformer:
Here is a 2D platformer created in 2 weeks using an engine provided by the instructor.
- Group of 4 students.
VideoGamesProjects.bibliotheque:
In this project, we had to create our own libraries. We had 1 week to develop the following libraries: Vector, Container, Collision, and an initial version of GameObject. We also explored unit testing to test our libraries.
- Group of 3 students.
VideoGamesProjects.textuelGameConsole:
Here is the first project implemented in C++, it's a text-based, turn-based game based on the theme of One Piece. It was a project to transition from C to C++ to solidify the fundamentals; we had 1 week.
- Group of 2 students.
VideoGamesProjects.shootEmUp:
Here is the major project completed at the end of the first year within a span of 2 weeks. We collaborated with the Business department, which was responsible for promoting the game, while we focused on its development.
- Group of 6 students.
VideoGamesProjects.luaPart1: Before joining the Gaming Campus, I developed in LUA on the FiveM platform for about 4 years. This experience allowed me to acquire strong knowledge in database management and creation, and I had the opportunity to work on Linux to manage various servers. Over these 4 years, I also created the
VideoGamesProjects.luaPart2: , allowing me to share my content with the community. Today, I have stopped the Polo Leaks project as I have explored all the possibilities it offered.
VideoGamesProjects.CSharpConsole:
Game in console, a turn-based game developed in 2 weeks. We had to create an ASCII map and make it attractive. We chose the theme of One Piece, and for the combat system, we had to create 3 types of AI: Easy, Normal, and Hard. We also conducted unit tests.

- Group of 4 students.
VideoGamesProjects.UnityRL:
A game developed in 2 weeks using the Unity game engine with several features such as procedural generation, Animation Curve, Drone AI, Input Management, Coroutines, OpenProBuilder, and other Unity basics.

- Group of 2 students.
VideoGamesProjects.CustomEngine:
During my 2nd year, I had the chance to make a custom engine with Vulkan in C++. I am mainly in charge of the network part, that is to say the TCP and UDP protocols and also the integration of sound via the FMOD library. The project was over 1 month.

- Group of 8 students.

WebProjects.Title: My Web Projects
WebProjects.Celtic:
Website for a basketball association created in 2 months. We were 100% volunteers to create it. We did the mockup, development, and deployment of the site.

- Personal project, we were 2 developers.
WebProjects.CelticTechno: Technologies used: HTML, CSS, PHP, JavaScript, Ajax, Bootstrap 5, cURL, jQuery, PHPMailer, SweetAlert, PDFjs, MySQL, Stripe API, Facebook Graph API
WebProjects.Eko:
Eko is an e-commerce website that also offers subscriptions. It was created in 2 weeks as part of a school project.

- Group of 4 students
WebProjects.EkoTechno: Payment API: Stripe, CSS, Bootstrap 5, PHP, JavaScript
WebProjects.BAImmobilier: Website created for the Baccalaureate, it was my first website. The goal was to create a fictional but realistic company.
WebProjects.GoudGuys:
Website for an esports association created in 1 month during an internship.

- We were 2 developers.
WebProjects.ShoppingSystem:
Here is a payment page and a shopping cart inspired by the JD Sport website, created in 1 week.

- Personal project
WebProjects.React:
Website created in my first year. The goal was to take a movie API provided by the instructor, and we had to create a first catalog with filters.

- First project in React

- Student project
WebProjects.ReactPortfolio:
Portfolio developed in React JS, integrating the following libraries: Axios, i18next, Font Awesome, and emailjs-com.

The technologies used include React, HTML, and CSS.

I paid special attention to SEO with optimization for Google Search, use of a Sitemap, and implementation of appropriate tags.

Chocolato.Description: I took part in a Game Jam organized by the school where I study. We had 48 hours to create a game on the theme of 'Dynamic Contrast', with 'Chocolate' as the artistic direction. I really enjoyed taking part in my first Game Jam, where I was able to learn and exchange ideas during the competition.
Chocolato.Alert: For the best experience, you need a joystick.

StaySoul.Description: I participated in my second Game Jam organized by my school in collaboration with Tap Nation. We had 42 hours to create a game on the theme 'Children's Games.' Thanks to my previous projects and the skills I have acquired, I was able to apply them to create a playable game with my teammates.
StaySoul.Alert: For the best experience, you need a mouse.

AttractionFlow.Description: Game Jam organized by TapNation X Gaming Campus where the theme was 'Attraction'. We had 42 hours to make a mobile game on this theme, and I am happy to present 'Attraction Flow'. A hyper-casual mobile game that is very easy to pick up!
AttractionFlow.Alert: For a better experience, you need a PC or a phone.

ShadowScholar.Description:
Play as Tyler Cross, an ordinary student whose life is turned upside down overnight. It all starts with a tragedy: he helplessly witnesses the death of his best friend during a moving cutscene. Thrust into a world of secrets, dangerous missions, and conspiracies, he must face a fate he never chose.

When his father, an agent of a secret government organization, goes missing during a mission, Tyler is forced to take up the mantle. Between infiltration, investigation, and shocking discoveries, he must piece together the puzzle to uncover the truth and possibly avenge his father.
ShadowScholar.ToolsUsed: Unity, Timeline, Cinemachine, Json Save, Profiler, Skeleton Animation, Animator, AI Navigation (Navmesh), GeNa
ShadowScholar.Role: Game concept, asset and texture placement, terrain and map creation, lighting, pathfinding, 50% gameplay, 80% cinematics, optimization, scene switching with asset loading

NavyBongo.Description: A solo Unity game project completed in just over a week. You control a boat, and the goal is to destroy all enemy towers within the time limit. The further you progress, the more powerful boats you unlock!
NavyBongo.ToolsUsed: Unity, Timeline, Cinemachine, Json Save, LOD, LOD Group, New Input System, HDRP, Shader Graph, Particle System
NavyBongo.Role: Game concept, full development and deployment

UIUXCooking.Description: A solo project focused on UI/UX, where I learned how to manipulate Unity's UI in depth. I explored grid layouts, dropdown menus, and used Scriptable Objects to manage ingredients and recipes. A great project to improve my Unity skills!
UIUXCooking.Alert: For a better experience, use a keyboard.
UIUXCooking.ToolsUsed: Unity, LitMotion, New Input System, Scriptable Object, Lit Motion, Animator, Animation, UI/UX, Shader Graph, Particle System

AngryBirds.Description: A solo project inspired by Angry Birds, where I applied mathematical knowledge to the game. I studied Unity's gravity and simulated my own, with and without air resistance. I implemented skills such as jump using recurrence, and a bird duplication feature simulating multiple trajectories using a math formula with an angle from 0 to π/2.
AngryBirds.Alert: For a better experience, use a mouse.
AngryBirds.ToolsUsed: Unity, LitMotion, New Input System, 2D Sprite/TileMap, Lit Motion, Mathematics, Physics, UI/UX, Line Renderer
AngryBirds.Role: Complete game and mathematical feature implementation

RATP.Title: RATP Maintenance Challenge
RATP.Description: A professional project in collaboration with RATP and my school. I was selected to work on this initiative to promote lesser-known RATP professions through video games. We're creating a dynamic, realistic station scene where players must repair faulty systems through gameplay.

DepthsOfHue.Description:
Final Bachelor project where we developed *Depths of Hue*, a puzzle game set in an immersive underwater world. The player, accompanied by a companion, explores a vibrant environment filled with challenges and mysteries.

Game Pitch: *Depths of Hue* is a mobile narrative puzzle game where solving enigmas allows players to recover fragmented memories and piece together an emotional and deep story.
DepthsOfHue.Alert: For a better experience, use a mouse.
DepthsOfHue.ToolsUsed: Unity, 2D NavMesh Plus, New & Old Input System, Addressables, Localization, Navigation, Mathematics, Scriptable Object, Shader Graph, TextMeshPro, Android & Windows, Json, Particle System, NaughtyAttributes
DepthsOfHue.Role: Lead Tech, Build Master (GitHub Actions then Jenkins), character and companion logic, exploration navigation, map system, debugging

UnityRL.Description: My first Unity game, aimed at learning the engine and its tools. Includes features such as procedural generation, animation curves, drone AI, input handling, OpenProBuilder, and other Unity basics.
UnityRL.Role: Full drone system, training map and features, input management

Funfair.Description:
I’m excited to present my first project on Unreal Engine 5.4, fully developed using Blueprints! This funfair simulation features several interactive rides and an immersive environment where NPCs bring the scene to life.

Initially, I focused on a knock-down cans game, bumper cars, and moving NPCs. I later expanded the project by adding roller coasters, a functioning Ferris wheel, and a coin system with a dynamic user interface for the player.
Funfair.ToolsUsed: Unreal Engine 5.4, 100% Blueprint, Spline Component, Niagara, NavMesh, Line Trace, Graphics, Game Mode, Animation
Funfair.Role: Ride scripting, AI behavior, Animation, User Interface

SpacialRace.Description: Physics-based project made with Unreal Engine 5.4 in a team of 3. We had to implement mechanics affecting the player's physics. I also learned to use the 'Chaos' tool. This project was developed half in C++ and half in Blueprint.
SpacialRace.ToolsUsed: Unreal Engine 5.4, C++/Blueprint, Spline Component, Niagara, Line Trace, Data Asset, JSON, Event
SpacialRace.Role: Spaceship customization system, Save system, Pre-game animation, Gravity inversion feature, Chaos, Spaceship physics

InventoryDemo.Title: Inventory System
InventoryDemo.Description: This is an inventory system featuring item dropping and item usage. The system is about 90% C++ and 10% Blueprint. Click, Hover, and UnHover events are dynamically added, with or without parameters, both for the inventory and the item drops.
InventoryDemo.ToolsUsed: Unreal Engine 5.4, C++/Blueprint, Data Asset, JSON, Event
InventoryDemo.Role: Inventory system, Item drop system, Shop, Item usage

Incoming.10: Production & Publishing Management in Jeu Vidéo
